intro: Siparuna trianae var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved siparuna, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its flowers are often followed by small, orange-red berries that are attractive to birds. Siparuna trianae var. latifolia is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
